item.title: Build a Voice Command Assistant with Node.js on Raspberry Pi
item.description: Build a voice-controlled assistant on a Raspberry Pi 3 using Node.js, PocketSphinx for speech recognition, and Node-RED for command orchestration. Architecture Three components communicate via MQTT: shirka_ears: Listens to microphone, publishes voice commands shirka_voice: Receives messages, converts to speech, plays audio Node-RED: Routes commands and responses between components The Ears Speech recognition using PocketSphinx: npm install pocketsphinx Listen for commands and publish to MQTT: const mqtt = require('mqtt'); const ps = require('pocketsphinx'); const client = mqtt.
